ygData.subject: Re: R: [EQ_Necromancer] Level 4 and 8 spells
ygData.msgSnippet: You mean goofy stuff like traveling out of your starting area or to any other place necs are KOS.  If you plan on traveling get Gather Shadows.
ygData.messageBody:
You mean goofy stuff like traveling out of your starting area or to any
other place necs are KOS. If you plan on traveling get Gather Shadows.

<-- Enigma -->
http://members.door.net/enigma



-----Original Message-----
From: Juan Custer [SMTP:JuanC@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 9:40 AM
To: 'EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com'
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] R: [EQ_Necromancer] Level 4 and 8 spells

From: Juan Custer <JuanC@...>


I disagree. Mostly. My preference is as follows...

Bone Walk, Ward Undead (its cheap too), Lesser Shielding, Mend Bones,
Gather
Shadows, Dark Empathy, Dark Pact.

There's no point to get Gather Shadows unless you want to do goofy stuff
that you probably don't need to be doing at your level. Ward is brutal
against the undead, and after you've practiced on your pet a million times
(did I mention this is your first Evocation thus you have NO skill in it?)
it will average 40 damage for 30 mana, which is very nice versus skeletons
and more powerful undead.

Dark Pact is very nice if you are in an area with a lot of lower level
stuff
you can drain off of, but its not totally cool since you won't have many
hitpoints yet. It WILL keep you in the field more. If you are going
undead
hunting I wouldn't suggest using it since you'll be Warding them more.

Malark on Karana

> take out much
> hp
> At level 8 I would get the spells in this order :
> Bone walk , mend bones , gather shadows , dark empathy ,
> lesser shielding .
> Someone told me Dark pact is good too but I havent checked it yet
>
